class butler.Butler(keywords=(), keep_keywords=True, setup_file='setup.json', session_parent_dir='C:\\Users\\jhart\\PycharmProjects\\butler\\butler\\experiments', output_variable_name='', data_variables=(), img_files=(), fig_files=(), data_files=(), ignore_colours=True, create_new_exp_on_run=False)ïƒ

Butler collects and organizes experiment data into folders while the experiment is running.

Parameters

  • keywords (str or list or tuple) â€“ List of keywords whose lines will be extracted when printed

  • keep_keywords (bool) â€“ Whether to also save the keywords with the rest of the print line

  • setup_file (str) â€“ Path to the json containing the setup mappings. E.g. {â€œgripperâ€: â€œrobotiq 2f85â€, â€¦}

  • session_parent_dir (str) â€“ Directory where to save the experiments; default is the butler.py directory

  • output_variable_name (str) â€“ The string name of the variable that contains the data that is otherwise returned by the decorated function. Has to be visible in the scope where the decorated function is called. E.g. self.data_var or just_data_var.

  • data_variables (list or tuple or str or dict[str, list or tuple or np.ndarray or str]) â€“ Sensor output variables. Format: {â€œsource_sensor_nameâ€: {â€œquantity (e.g. postiion)â€: [list, of, values], â€¦}, â€¦}

  • img_files (list[str] or tuple[str]) â€“ List of file paths that will be copied to experiment_i/property_j/imgs every time the function is run.

  • fig_files (list[str] or tuple[str]) â€“ List of file paths that will be copied to experiment_i/property_j/figs every time the function is run.

  • data_files (list[str] or tuple[str]) â€“ List of file paths that will be copied to experiment_i/property_j/data every time the function is run.

  • ignore_colours (bool) â€“ Whether to ignore the special colour characters; in regex: â€œ[d+](;d+)?mâ€

  • create_new_exp_on_run (bool) â€“ Whether to create a new experiment_i folder on every run of the function.

Adds files to be copied to the folder: property_j/[data, imgs, figs] when the function decorated by @butler is called.

Parameters

formatting.convert_experiments(interval='__all__')ïƒ

Format the experiments in the config.experiment_directory folder to dicts.

Parameters

interval (str or list) â€“

Date interval between which to convert the experiments.

Values:

â€__all__â€: all experiments - ok if you call this manually and you dont have thousands of properties

[a or None, b or None] - from a to b or all before b or all after a. Format: YYYY_mm_dd_HH_MM_SS

formatting.experiment_to_json(experiment_directory, out_file=None)ïƒ

Takes a butlered experiment folder and converts it into a dictionary that is in the format that will be uploaded to the server.

Parameters

  • experiment_directory (str) â€“ The experiment{i} directory containing the directory structure as specified in butler.py

  • out_file (str or None) â€“ Absolute path to the output file. â€œ*.jsonâ€ to write to the output file, None to not write to a file.

Returns

Returns the processed experiment in the form of a dict, which close to the final format for uploading.

Return type

uploading.get_file_names(formatted_dict)ïƒ

Collects the file names to be uploaded to the server from the formatted dictionary.

Parameters

formatted_dict (dict) â€“ The dictionary as it is output by formatting.experiment_to_json

Returns

A dictionary with:

keys: Space-notation strings to where the files belong on the server. E.g. measurement.png / measurement[â€œpngâ€] => â€œmeasurement pngâ€.

values: Absolute file paths on the local machine.
